Pre-Kindergarten (Pre-K) and Kindergarten enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year is currently open. All Families (new, returning, and Form 2) can enroll online and submit required documents via email to residency@raytownschools.org. New and Form 2 families will receive an email with dates in July and August to visit the Enrollment Center in person to validate documents sent via email. Please note, online enrollment for the 2020-21 school year for students in grades 1-12 will open on July 27, 2020.

The Raytown School District follows a centralized enrollment process, which starts at the Residency Office and is an individualized process for each family. All students must live within the school district boundaries, submit the required documents to the Residency Office, and submit an online registration to complete the enrollment process.

For more information about Residency and Enrollment, visit https://bit.ly/2V9Oh5P.

Congrats to Raytown High School senior Sydni Caw who will serve as a delegate to the Congress of Future Medical Leaders, June 24-26. The Congress is an honors program for high school students who want to become physicians or go into the medical field.

During the three-day event, Caw will join other students from around the country to hear from Nobel Laureates and National Medal of Science Winners as they talk about leading medical research and receive advice from Ivy League and top medical school deans on what to expect in medical school.

After graduation, Caw plans to continue her education and play volleyball at Ottawa University in Ottawa, KS where she will be majoring in Pre-Medical Science.

Raytown High School students in the student leadership organization, Jay Crew, will sponsor a district-wide and community-wide, online only, fundraising drive to benefit the Raytown Emergency Assistance Program as part of the Lead4Change: Student Leadership Program.

The online fundraising drive is going on now through April 24 and all donations can be made on the Raytown Emergency Assistance Program website at https://raytownreap.org/donate/ or by clicking on the link below. This will replace the district-wide competition and community food drive Jay Crew hosts each year. Please note that this donation drive is online only.

Over the past four years, Jay Crew students have collected more than 100,000 items for REAP, collected around $10,000, and won $22,000 for REAP. This will be the fifth year Jay Crew will participate in the project.

Earlier this year, Raytown High School Jay Crew collaborated with Raytown South High student council to sponsor the Fire and Ice chili cook-off benefiting REAP.

Pre-Kindergarten (Pre-K) and Kindergarten enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year opens on March 2, 2020.

All New family enrollments to the Raytown School District can pre-register by clicking Register New Family on the enrollment site.
Families who currently have students in the Raytown School District and would like to add a new Pre-K or Kindergarten student, will see the option to enroll once they log into their existing parent portal.

All New Family enrollments that pre-register will need to visit the Enrollment Center with required documentation to validate their profile.

All returning families can enroll online and submit required documents via upload through the student portal, fax (816-268-7079), email (residency@raytownschools.org) or in person at the Enrollment Center.

All returning Form 2 families can complete enrollment online, but will need to visit the Enrollment Center with required documentation.

Open enrollment for new families (including all Form2/waiver families) will occur at the Enrollment Center.

For more information, visit https://bit.ly/2wb5hPc.
